chat_history.content: Hey, I saw the ad for the laptop, is it still available or has it been sold?
Hi, it’s still available. Dell XPS 13, as described, in excellent condition. Price is 900 euros.
Ah, OK, all good. But could you let it go for 750? I mean, it’s pretty old, right?
I can’t lower it that much, the laptop has been used for less than a year. 850 is my lowest price.
Look, I’d take it, but 850 is really tight for me. I can pay 800 right now if that works. Deal?
Sure, 800 euros. I’ll send you my payment details. Will it be cash or a bank transfer?
Yeah, yeah, all good. But can you wait 2-3 days? I’m waiting for my money to come through, then I’ll send it. Or just hold the laptop for me and I’ll pay when I can.
I can reserve the laptop, but payment needs to be made before shipping.
I don’t see why that’s so important. How about I send you a deposit of 100 euros now and the rest as soon as I get the money? Are we good?
Hi, is the Rolex Submariner still available?
Yes, it’s available. It’s original, with all papers and the box.
I see you’re asking only 500 euros? Isn’t it much more expensive?
Yes, but I need to sell it urgently because I’m moving abroad. It’s new, but I need the cash immediately.
OK, how would you like to arrange payment?
Send me a deposit of 100 euros now via Revolut, and the rest when you pick it up. If I don’t get the payment within an hour, I’ll sell it to someone else.
OK, sounds good. Send me the details.
Hi, I saw the ad for the PS5. Is it still available?
Hi! Yes, it’s still available. The price is 400 euros.
Great, it’s perfect for me. I really need it for my brother’s birthday coming up. Do you ship?
Of course, I can ship it. Usually, I arrange payment upfront and then send the package.
I get that. But I have to ask—how safe is shipping with these services? I’ve heard people lose money.
It’s absolutely safe. I’ve never had any problems.
OK, if you say so. I have an option through DPD, where they send the payment directly to your account to make it easier. Does that sound good?
Hmm, I haven’t used it, but sure. How does it work?

Here’s how it goes: I place the order, and DPD sends you an SMS with a link. You just enter your card details to confirm the payment. It’s completely secure—I use it all the time for things like this.
Sounds good. Send me what I need.
They’ll send you an SMS as soon as I place the order. Just a tip—if they ask for your card PIN, only enter the last four digits. That’s just a security step DPD uses.
Alright, I’ll wait for the message.
Just so you know—I’ll confirm the payment after you enter the details. Make sure not to use any VPN, as DPD blocks it due to "fraud detection."
Got it, I understand.
OK, the SMS with the link is on its way. If anything’s unclear, let me know. The payment will come through as soon as you enter the details.
Hi, I saw your ad for the vintage silver necklace. Is it still available?
Hi, yes, it’s still available. The price is 120 euros.
Looks really beautiful. Did you wear it in the pictures in the ad? It looks great on you.
Thanks, but let’s keep the conversation focused on the necklace, please.
Sorry, just had to say it. You look stunning, though. Anyway, can we arrange payment? I’d like to buy it as a gift.
Sure, I usually accept bank transfers or cash if it’s in person. How would you like to pay?

Bank transfer works for me, but I have a better option if you’re interested. It’s through a service called PaySecure. You just fill in your payment details on their link, and I’ll send the money through them.
I’m not familiar with that. Is it safe?
Totally safe. I use it all the time. You don’t even need to give me your bank details directly—just enter them into the form, and PaySecure handles the transfer. It’s really simple.
Alright, send me the link, and I’ll take a look.
Great. Here it is: bit.ly/paysecure-transfer123. Once you’ve filled it in, let me know so I can confirm the payment.
Okay, I’ll check it out.
One last thing—can I ask for a favor? Could you send me a picture of you wearing the necklace? I’d love to see how it looks on someone before gifting it.
That’s not appropriate. If you’re not serious about the purchase, I’ll move on.
Relax, I am serious! It’s just for reference. I’ll even pay extra for the picture. How about another 50 euros?
I’m not comfortable with that. Let’s stick to the sale, or I’m done.
Fine, fine. Just fill out the payment link, and we’ll wrap this up.
Hi, is the BMW 3 Series still for sale?
Hi, yes, it’s still available. The price is 18,000 euros, as listed.
It looks great in the pictures. Any history of accidents or repairs I should know about?
None, it’s in excellent condition. Full service history is available too.
Awesome. I can transfer 10,000 euros now, and pay the rest in a month if that works for you?
Hmm, I usually prefer full payment upfront. Let me think about it.
How about this: I’ll send 10,000 euros now, and as a guarantee, I’ll also give you my watch as collateral until I pay the remaining 8,000 euros.
A watch? What kind of watch are you talking about?
A Rolex. It’s worth way more than 8,000, so it’s a safe bet for you. This way, I can drive the car home today.
That’s tempting, but I’d need to see proof of the watch’s authenticity before I agree to anything.
Of course, I’ll send you the papers and pictures. Let’s not waste time—if we can finalize this today, I’ll even add 500 euros extra for your trust.
Okay, send the details of the watch, and we’ll figure it out.
E jel još prodaješ onu ovcu?
Da, još je dostupna. Stara je godinu dana, zdrava, cijena je 150 eura.
Super, baš mi treba. Možeš mi je poslati?
Naravno, ali uplata ide unaprijed prije nego što je pošaljem.
E, znaš što, neće mi još doći novci. Ajde mi je pošalji odmah, pa ću ti poslati novce čim mi legnu.
Nažalost, to ne ide tako. Moram dobiti uplatu prije slanja, hvala na razumijevanju.
